result.execSummary:
The defendant Kohl A Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*Sign releases to monitor case as recommended by the Agent
*Obtain other counseling or assessments as recommended by the Agent
*Provide DNA Sample

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Kohl A Baker in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:56 a.m. Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 3 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 120 jail sentence 
Huber for counseling, work and educational services - 1/2 to be served in jail and 1/2 on monitoring if approved by the jail and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 2 years 
Pay Costs including the DNA Surcharge 
Serve 5 days conditional jail and all 5 days to be served in the jail - huber for employment, counseling and education
1 day jail credit
To be served in Portage of Marathon County in the next 60 days
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign releases to monitor case as recommended by the agent 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Obtain other counseling or assessments as recommended by the Agent.
Provide a DNA Sample.

Count 2 -  DRI
 
Count 3 -
Impose/Stay a 120 jail sentence concurrent to Count 1
Huber for counseling, work and educational services - 1/2 to be served in jail and 1/2 on monitoring if approved by the jail and risk assessment
Placed on Probation for 2 years to run concurrent to Count 1 
Pay Court costs - DNA Surcharge 
Perform 10 hours of Community Service on Count 2 only
Comply with conditions in Count 1 

Appeal rights provided to Defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kohl A Baker in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
P/NG entered on his behalf.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of:
(Kohl Baker - Possession w/ Intent to Deliver-LSD, Possession of Controlled Substance in Jail,  Resisting/Obstructing an Officer, Bail Jumping)
(Elizabeth Brilowski - Possession w/ Intent to Deliver-LSD, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia)
(Alfonso Diaz - Possession of LSD-2nd offense, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia)
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/02/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Do not possess controlled substances. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
